title: In the Ukrainian Carpathians, peace feels both near and far
subhead: In Uzhhorod, a border city near Slovakia, exhausted and disillusioned residents have long stopped believing in victory and expect little from ongoing diplomatic talks. They only hope that the war will end, even 'if it means sacrificing a piece of the country to be saved.'

title: US tariff threats over Greenland pose 'more political than economic' consequences for Europe
Israeli hostages in Gaza recount sexual violence during their captivity
Macron denounces US competition seeking to 'subordinate Europe'
subhead: In a speech at the World Economic Forum in Davos, French President Emmanuel Macron also decried an 'endless accumulation of new tariffs that are fundamentally unacceptable.'

title: Trump calls UK's Chagos Islands handover act of 'stupidity'
subhead: London had secured the right to maintain a major joint military base with the US on Diego Garcia. Washington, which in May had called the Indian Ocean archipelago's transfer to Mauritius a 'monumental achievement,' has now reversed its position.

title: PSG's bid for top eight finish jeopardized after Lisbon loss
subhead: Despite being largely dominant, Paris Saint-Germain struggled to create genuine chances, their combinations around the penalty area proving too weak and predictable for the Lisbon defense. 'The result is disappointing and unfair,' said coach Luis Enrique of the 2-1 defeat.

title: Marine Duc, geographer: 'In Greenland, the memory of colonial violence remains strong'
subhead: Donald Trump's ambitions for the Arctic island have affected Danish policies toward the Inuit population and influenced the expression of Greenlandic nationalism, the academic explained in an interview with Le Monde.

title: Venezuela says it has received $300 million from US oil sale used to prop up currency
Mexico hands over dozens more suspected cartel members to US
Trump's 'board of peace' fails to spark enthusiasm among world leaders
Vice President JD Vance and his wife Usha Vance say they are expecting their fourth child
New documentary offers rare look inside Macron's diplomatic team
French PM forces part of 2026 budget through Parliament without a vote
Rights groups report widespread sexual violence against Palestinians in Israeli prisons
US says it seized another tanker in the Caribbean
Denmark's far right is mired in contradictions over Greenland
In 'Hamnet,' love is haunted by the specter of death
'Article 49.3': How France's government can pass a budget without a vote
Philharmonie de Paris director responds to protest at Israeli orchestra performance
Yann Le Cun: 'Why I'm leaving Meta to launch my own AI start-up'
subhead: The former head of artificial intelligence research at Meta explains his decision to start a new company focused on the physical world, citing strategic differences with the American tech giant and predicting a 'third AI revolution' in the coming years.

title: In one year, Trump has imposed a culture of impunity
subhead: Since returning to the White House, the American president has exempted himself from all rules, both domestically and internationally. This sense of impunity now permeates his entire administration.

title: The strange airborne rescue of Gaza's donkeys, from Israel to Europe
subhead: Since 2022, Sharon Cohen, who runs an animal rescue group near Tel Aviv, has removed donkeys from Palestinian owners she accuses of mistreatment and sent them to shelters across Europe. The initiative has drawn outrage amid Gaza's deepening humanitarian crisis.

title: France's Parliament must be protected from the fever of the presidential election
The necessary showdown with Donald Trump
Cynthia Miller-Idriss, sociologist: 'Far-right violence is now official US government policy and practice'
